title: Mastery+ German - Native-Level Idioms & Complex Structures

questions.question: Da beißt die Maus keinen Faden ab.
options: You can't get blood from a stone.
The mouse won't bite any thread there.
questions.explanation: This idiom means something is impossible or hopeless

questions.question: Er hat nicht alle Tassen im Schrank.
options: Er hat einen an der Waffel.
He's not the sharpest tool in the shed.
He doesn't have all cups in the cupboard.
questions.explanation: Common idiom for someone being crazy or eccentric

questions.question: Das ist mir Wurst.
questions.explanation: Colloquial expression for complete indifference

questions.question: Ich verstehe nur Bahnhof.
questions.explanation: Idiom meaning you don't understand anything at all

questions.question: Er spinnt doch!
questions.explanation: 'Spinnen' colloquially means to be crazy/nuts

questions.question: Das passt wie die Faust aufs Auge.
options: That fits like the fist on the eye.
questions.explanation: Ironical idiom meaning something is a very bad fit

questions.question: Ich glaub mein Schwein pfeift.
questions.explanation: Expression of surprise/disbelief (like 'pigs might fly')

questions.question: Du gehst mir auf den Keks.
questions.explanation: Colloquial expression for annoying someone

questions.question: Das ist doch klar wie Kloßbrühe.
options: That's as clear as dumpling broth.
questions.explanation: Broth from dumplings is very clear - means completely obvious

questions.question: Er hat einen an der Klatsche.
options: He has one at the clapper.
He's not quite right in the head.
questions.explanation: Another colloquialism for being slightly crazy

questions.question: Da steppt der Bär.
questions.explanation: Expression meaning something is really happening/fun

questions.question: Ich hab die Nase voll.
questions.explanation: Common expression for being fed up with something

questions.question: Lass mal die Kirche im Dorf.
options: Leave the church in the village.
questions.explanation: Idiom meaning don't exaggerate or get too excited

questions.question: Das ist Jacke wie Hose.
questions.explanation: Idiom meaning two things are essentially the same

questions.question: Jetzt mal butter bei die Fische.
questions.explanation: Expression urging someone to speak plainly/directly

questions.question: Er hat sich ins Knie gefallen.
options: He shot himself in the foot.
questions.explanation: German equivalent of 'shot himself in the foot'

questions.question: Das ist nicht das Gelbe vom Ei.
options: That's not the yellow of the egg.
That's not the best/crème de la crème.
questions.explanation: The egg yolk is the best part - means not the best quality

questions.question: Ich bin fix und fertig.
questions.explanation: Common expression for being completely exhausted

questions.question: Das geht mir gegen den Strich.
questions.explanation: Something that goes against one's nature/principles

questions.question: Er sitzt zwischen den Stühlen.
questions.explanation: German equivalent of 'falling between two stools'

questions.question: Da liegt der Hund begraben.
options: That's where the dog is buried.
That's the crux of the matter.
questions.explanation: Idiom indicating the heart/core of the problem

questions.question: Jetzt geht's um die Wurst.
questions.explanation: Expression for when things get serious/decisive

questions.question: Ich bin auf dem Schlauch.
options: Ich habe ein Brett vor dem Kopf.
questions.explanation: Expression for when you can't think of something

questions.question: Das hat er sich in den Kopf gesetzt.
options: He set that in his head.
questions.explanation: Means someone is determined/dogged about something

questions.question: Sie hat ihn auf dem Kieker.
options: She has her eye on him./She's after him.
She has him on the keeker.
questions.explanation: 'Kieker' (spyglass) means watching/targeting someone

questions.question: Das lässt er sich nicht zweimal sagen.
options: He doesn't let that be said to him twice.
questions.explanation: Eager/willing to do something immediately

questions.question: Er hat das Herz auf dem rechten Fleck.
options: He has his heart in the right spot.
He's a good person at heart.
questions.explanation: German equivalent of 'heart in the right place'

questions.question: Das ist mir zu hoch.
questions.explanation: Something is too complex/difficult to understand

questions.question: Sie nimmt kein Blatt vor den Mund.
options: She doesn't take a leaf before her mouth.
questions.explanation: Not mincing words, speaking plainly/bluntly

questions.question: Er redet sich um Kopf und Kragen.
options: He talks himself around head and collar.
He's talking himself into big trouble.
questions.explanation: Talking oneself into serious danger/trouble

questions.question: Das ist ein Fass ohne Boden.
options: That's a barrel without a bottom.
questions.explanation: Something that seems endless or consumes unlimited resources

questions.question: Ich stehe auf dem Schlauch.
questions.explanation: Having a mental block, can't think of something

questions.question: Das ist nicht von Pappe.
questions.explanation: 'Nicht von Pappe sein' means to be impressive/competent

questions.question: Er ist auf dem Trockenen.
questions.explanation: Having no more alcohol, or colloquially: having no money

questions.question: Die Kirche im Dorf lassen.
options: Leave the church in the village.
questions.explanation: Stay grounded, don't exaggerate or get ahead of yourself

questions.question: Da kannst du Gift drauf nehmen.
options: You can bet your life on it.
You can take poison on that.
questions.explanation: Extremely certain about something

questions.question: Er hat einen Vogel.
questions.explanation: Colloquial expression for being crazy

questions.question: Das ist unter aller Sau.
questions.explanation: Vulgar expression for something being really bad

questions.question: Ich bin raus aus der Nummer.
options: I'm done with that./Count me out.
questions.explanation: Withdrawing from a situation/commitment

questions.question: Er hat sie alle nicht mehr.
options: He doesn't have them all anymore.
Er ist nicht mehr ganz dicht.
questions.explanation: Colloquial for being crazy or not thinking clearly

questions.question: Das ist mir schnurzpiepegal.
questions.explanation: Very colloquial expression for complete indifference

questions.question: Da hast du den Salat.
questions.explanation: Now there's trouble/a mess (from 'salad' meaning confusion)

questions.question: Er ist auf Wolke sieben.
questions.explanation: German uses cloud seven, English uses cloud nine

questions.question: Das geht auf keine Kuhhaut.
options: That doesn't go on any cowhide.
questions.explanation: Something is so unbelievable it couldn't be written down

questions.question: Ich habe die Schnauze voll.
questions.explanation: Vulgar way of saying you're fed up (like 'up to here')

questions.question: Er ist auf dem Holzweg.
options: He's barking up the wrong tree.
questions.explanation: Completely mistaken, on the wrong track

questions.question: Das macht nicht die Bohne.
questions.explanation: Something makes no difference whatsoever

questions.question: Er ist nicht die hellste Kerze auf der Torte.
options: He's not the brightest candle on the cake.
He's not the sharpest knife in the drawer.
questions.explanation: Euphemism for someone not being very smart

questions.question: Ich habe keine Lust mehr, mir das anzutun.
options: I have no more desire to do that to myself.
Ich will das nicht mehr machen.
questions.explanation: No longer willing to put up with something

questions.question: Das ist ein typisches Rohrkrepierer.
questions.explanation: Something that fizzles out, fails to meet expectations

questions.question: Er ist auf Kriegsfuß mit ihm.
questions.explanation: Being in conflict/at odds with someone

questions.question: Das hat er davon.
options: That's what he has from it.
questions.explanation: Serves him right, he got what he deserved

questions.question: Ich bin schwer von Begriff.
questions.explanation: Self-deprecating way of saying you're slow to understand

questions.question: Er hat sie nicht alle.
questions.explanation: Euphemism for being crazy or eccentric

questions.question: Das ist nicht mein Bier.
questions.explanation: None of my business, not my concern

questions.question: Er hat einen Rappel.
questions.explanation: Colloquial for temporary craziness or obsession

questions.question: Das ist nicht mehr feierlich.
questions.explanation: Something has gone beyond acceptable limits

questions.question: Ich bin raus.
questions.explanation: Leaving, done with something, not participating

questions.question: Er hat den Schuss nicht gehört.
options: Er ist nicht auf dem Laufenden.
questions.explanation: Missed an opportunity, didn't understand what's happening

questions.question: Das ist weder Fisch noch Fleisch.
options: Das ist nicht das eine oder andere.
questions.explanation: Something ambiguous, not clearly one thing or another

questions.question: Er ist ein Schlawiner.
questions.explanation: Someone clever/sly in a slightly negative way

questions.question: Das ist doch alles Käse.
questions.explanation: Colloquial way of saying something is nonsense

questions.question: Ich habe den Überblick verloren.
questions.explanation: Can't keep track of everything anymore

questions.question: Er hat den Bogen raus.
options: He's got the hang of it.
questions.explanation: Has figured out how to do something well

questions.question: Das ist alles nur heiße Luft.
questions.explanation: Same idiom as English - empty talk without substance

questions.question: Er ist ein fauler Zauber.
questions.explanation: Someone unreliable, lazy, or of low quality

questions.question: Das geht mir auf die Nerven.
questions.explanation: Direct equivalent of 'getting on one's nerves'

questions.question: Er hat den Dreh raus.
options: He's got the hang of it.
questions.explanation: Has mastered the technique, knows how to do it

questions.question: Das ist ein Scheißtag.
questions.explanation: Vulgar expression for a really bad day

questions.question: Er macht einen auf dicke Hose.
options: He makes one on thick pants.
He's acting all big and important.
Er tut so, als wäre er wichtig.
questions.explanation: Acting arrogant, putting on airs

questions.question: Ich bin am Ende.
questions.explanation: Completely exhausted or out of options

questions.question: Das ist zum Kotzen.
questions.explanation: Vulgar expression for something really bad/disgusting

questions.question: Er ist ein armer Schlucker.
questions.explanation: Pitiful person in unfortunate circumstances

questions.question: Das ist mir egal, wie das Kind heißt.
options: I don't care what the child is called.
questions.explanation: Emphatic way of saying you don't care at all

questions.question: Er hat einen an der Waffel.
options: He has one at the waffle.
questions.explanation: Colloquial expression for being slightly crazy

questions.question: Das ist alles Müll.
questions.explanation: Something is completely worthless or untrue

questions.question: Er ist ein armer Irrer.
questions.explanation: Colloquial, slightly pitying way of saying someone is crazy

questions.question: Ich habe keinen Bock mehr.
questions.explanation: Vulgar way of saying you've had enough, lost motivation

questions.question: Das ist ja wohl der Hammer.
questions.explanation: Expression of amazement (positive or negative)

questions.question: Er ist nicht ganz dicht.
questions.explanation: Euphemism for someone being slightly crazy

questions.question: Das ist doch alles hohles Geschwätz.
questions.explanation: Something is meaningless, empty talk without substance

questions.question: Er ist ein armer Tropf.
questions.explanation: Pitiable, unfortunate person

questions.question: Ich bin am Verzweifeln.
questions.explanation: At the point of despair, don't know what to do

questions.question: Das ist zum Mäusemelken.
questions.explanation: Idiom for something extremely difficult or pointless

questions.question: Er ist ein fauler Hund.
questions.explanation: Colloquial way of calling someone lazy/useless

questions.question: Ich habe die Nase gestrichen voll.
options: I have my nose rubbed full.
questions.explanation: Emphatic version of being fed up

questions.question: Das ist doch alles Humbug.
questions.explanation: Old-fashioned but still used term for nonsense

questions.question: Er ist ein armer Wicht.
questions.explanation: Old-fashioned term for a pitiable person

questions.question: Ich bin am Ende meiner Weisheit.
options: I'm at the end of my wisdom.
questions.explanation: Don't know what to do anymore, out of ideas

questions.question: Das ist doch alles dummes Zeug.
questions.explanation: Dismissive way of saying something is nonsense

questions.question: Er ist ein ganz Fieser.
questions.explanation: Colloquial way of saying someone is nasty/mean

questions.question: Ich habe keine Nerven mehr dafür.
options: I have no more nerves for that.
I can't deal with that anymore.
Ich kann das nicht mehr ertragen.
questions.explanation: Don't have the patience/nerves to deal with something

questions.question: Das ist doch alles Makulatur.
questions.explanation: 'Makulatur' literally means waste paper, used for worthless things

questions.question: Er ist ein ganz Übler.
questions.explanation: Colloquial way of saying someone is bad/nasty

questions.question: Ich bin am Ende meines Lateins.
options: I'm at the end of my Latin.
questions.explanation: Idiomatic expression for being out of ideas/solutions

questions.question: Das ist doch alles Schnee von gestern.
options: That's all old hat/water under the bridge.
questions.explanation: Something is outdated, no longer relevant

questions.question: Er ist ein ganz Gemeiner.
questions.explanation: Colloquial way of saying someone is mean

questions.question: Ich habe die Schnauze gestrichen voll.
options: I have my snout rubbed full.
questions.explanation: Vulgar, emphatic way of saying you're fed up

questions.question: Das ist doch alles Quatsch.
questions.explanation: 'Quatsch' is a common colloquial word for nonsense

questions.question: Er ist ein armer Irrer.
questions.explanation: Colloquial, slightly pitying term for someone crazy
